intro: Photinia melanocarpa, commonly known as the black leafed evergreen holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rosaceae. It is native to eastern Australia and is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves that remain on the plant year-round. The plant produces small, white flowers that appear in late spring, followed by red berries in the autumn. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and hardy nature. Photinia melanocarpa thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade conditions.
